title: Anxious, risk-averse Britain will struggle to resist the anti-firework activists forever
text:
It is an annual ritual almost as familiar as the rockets, fountains and screaming banshees that stream above the rooftops in the period between Diwali (the Hindu festival of light, which is taking place now) and Bonfire Night. Last year, the drive to ban fireworks was led by one of the country’s most senior police officers. This year it is a clutch of Left-wing MPs. Jacob Rees-Mogg fended off interventions in the Commons on the issue last week, clarifying that the Government were not “po-faced enders of fun” and so would not be stopping the sale of Roman candles and the like.
